summary: This is an email chain from July 2019 between FBI personnel regarding the Epstein case, specifically coordinating surveillance of Epstein's private jet at the airport in St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands, and discussing potential law enforcement actions related to an arrest warrant.

persons.name: Joseph Picarello
persons.context: Appears as a recipient of the email, involved in discussions about the Epstein case and potential airport surveillance.

persons.name: Guillermo Gonzalez
persons.context: Appears as a recipient of the email (cc'd), involved in FBI coordination regarding the Epstein case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the subject of the case; his private jet is to be surveilled at the airport in St. Thomas.

connections.description: Both are law enforcement personnel (NYPD and FBI) coordinating on the Epstein case, as shown by being cc'd on the same email.
The FBI is actively investigating Epstein, discussing surveillance of his jet and an arrest warrant.

events.title: Email coordination on Epstein surveillance
events.description: FBI personnel email NYPD and other FBI contacts to coordinate quiet surveillance of Epstein's private jet at the St. Thomas airport and discuss the status of his arrest warrant.

keyFacts: In July 2019, the FBI was actively coordinating with NYPD to surveil Jeffrey Epstein's private jet at the airport in St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands.
The email discusses an arrest warrant for Epstein and potential law enforcement actions needed in St. Thomas.
The FBI indicates familiarity with Epstein in the U.S. Virgin Islands context, suggesting prior investigative knowledge of his activities there.
